comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content:
From Wikipedia," Rossin House Hotel was a mid-19th Century hotel located at the corner of King Street and York Street in Toronto. The original structure was built in 1856 and was destroyed by a fire and re-built in 1863. ...

The five-storey hotel was renamed the Prince George Hotel in 1909 after the future British monarch. It was demolished in 1969 and replaced by architect Mies van der Rohe's Toronto-Dominion Centre."
